required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Protein Supplementation and Skeletal Muscle Healing Process
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Protein Supplementation on Skeletal Muscle Regeneration and Healing Process Following Exercise-induced Aseptic Injury

brief_summary.textblock: In this study the investigators utilized protein supplementation over an 8-day period following eccentric exercise-induced muscle damage in order to test the initial hypotheses : i) protein supplementation after exercise-induced muscle injury affects exercise-induced aseptic inflammation and muscle performance.

detailed_description.textblock: The objective was to examine weather protein supplementation is able to affect the inflammatory response as well as recovery of muscle performance following an intense eccentric exercise protocol. In a double-blind, counterbalanced design, 14 men received either Placebo (PLA) or milk protein isolate (PRO) for 8 consecutive days following a single bout of exercise (300 eccentric contractions at 30 deg/sec). In both conditions, performance was assessed at baseline, immediately post-exercise, 2h post-exercise and daily for 8 consecutive days. Blood samples were collected at baseline, 2h post-exercise and daily for the remaining 8 days. Muscle biopsies from vastus lateralis were collected at baseline as well as at day 2 and day 8 of the post-exercise period.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in reduced glutathione in blood
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1h before exercise, 2h post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise
primary_outcome.description: Concentration of reduced glutathione in red blood cells

primary_outcome.measure: Change in protein carbonyls in serum
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1h before exercise, 2h post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change in protein carbonyls in muscle
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1h before exercise, 2 days post-exercise, 8 days post-exercise
primary_outcome.description: Protein carbonyl concentration in quadriceps skeletal muscle group

primary_outcome.measure: Change in thiobarbituric acid and reactive substances in serum
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1h before exercise, 2h post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise
primary_outcome.description: Thiobarbituric acid reactive substances concentration in serum

primary_outcome.measure: Change in oxidized glutathione in blood
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1h before exercise, 2h post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise
primary_outcome.description: Concentration of oxidized glutathione in red blood cells

primary_outcome.measure: Change in total antioxidant capacity in serum
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1h before exercise, 2h post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change in catalase activity in serum
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1h before exercise, 2h post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change in creatine kinase activity in plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1h before exercise, 2h post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change in C-reactive protein in plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1h before exercise, 2h post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change in white blood cell count in blood
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1h before exercise, 2h post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in volume and morphological complexity of immune cells
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1h before exercise, 2h post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change in neutrophil count in blood
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1h before exercise, 2h post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change in glucose concentration in blood
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1h before exercise, 2h post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change in insulin concentration in blood
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1h before exercise, 2h post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change in testosterone concentration in plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1h before exercise, 2h post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change in cytokine concentration in plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1h before exercise, 2h post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of IL-1β, IL-4, IL-6, IL-8, IL-10, TNF-α

primary_outcome.measure: Change in adhesion molecule concentration in blood
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1h before exercise, 2h post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change in intracellular signalling proteins in muscle
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1h before exercise, 2 days post-exercise, 8 days post-exercise
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of phosphorylation levels of mammalian target of rapamycin (mTOR), ribosomal protein S6 (rpS6) and nuclear factor kB (NFkB), and protein expression levels of forkhead box protein O1 (FOXO1), HSP70, and parkin.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in proteasome activities in muscle
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1h before exercise, 2 days post-exercise, 8 days post-exercise
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of LLVY, LSTR and LLE

primary_outcome.measure: Change in protein expression level of proteasome subunits
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1h before exercise, 2 days post-exercise, 8 days post-exercise
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of B1i, B2i, B5i, B5, B1, B2 and α7

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in muscle function of knee extensor and flexor muscle
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1h before exercise, 5 min post-exercise, 2h post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of muscle peak and mean torque of knee extensors and flexors on an isokinetic dynamometer at 0, 90 and 180 degrees/sec

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1h before exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of dietary intake with emphasis on protein consumption

arm_group.description: Milk protein isolate supplementation: orally, 20g of protein immediately post-exercise and then 20g every 3h on 3 occasions (+3, +6, +9), on the exercise day. The remaining 8 days, 20g daily with breakfast.
Placebo administration: orally 500 ml, immediately post-exercise as well as at +3, +6 and +9 hours, on the exercise day. The remaining 8 days, 500 ml daily with breakfast.

intervention.description: Milk protein isolate in a powder form consisted of 80% casein and 20% whey protein. 20g were diluted into 500 ml water. Placebo consisted of 365 ml water, 125 ml sugar-free cordial and 2g of low-calorie glucose/dextrose powder.
500 mL drink that contained water (375 mL), sugar-free cordial (125 mL) and 2 g of low-calorie glucose/dextrose powder.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- a) recreationally trained as indicated by the maximal oxygen consumption levels (VO2max > 45 ml/kg/min), b) engaged in systematic exercise at least three times per week for > 12 months, c) non-smokers, d) abstained from any vigorous physical activity during the study, e) abstained from consumption of caffeine, alcohol, performance-enhancing or antioxidant supplements, and medications during the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- a) a recent febrile illness, b) history of muscle lesion, c) lower limb trauma

overall_official.affiliation: UNIVERSITY OF THESSALY, SCHOOL OF PHYSICAL EDUCATION & SPORTS SCIENCES
